storyInfo: Hoederer's group finds the Sarkaz Lifeline and realizes that the mysterious vehicle that has been laying Arts Circles and mirages around the battlefield is a Feranmut with only bleached bones left.

attributes.text: How absurd it is that we're chasing illusions on this battlefield full of bones, blood, smoke and mud.
\nThe illusions are our only clue. Like the Lich said, the drifting fragments of history are the tracks it left behind.
\nWe passed through many ruins, some long-forgotten, some never remembered to begin with.
\nSoon, these sights will be gone too. Many times we barely arrived in time to grasp the last traces.
We found seventeen Vampire War Arts Circles.
\nThere are maybe dozens more... maybe even hundreds more of them on this battlefield.
\nThey all appeared within the past week, a scary level of efficiency.
We found troop tracks on two of them, but the marks indicated that the troops were only on maintenance or patrol missions.
\nI doubt there's much point to destroying the Arts Circles. They could easily replace them with new ones.
\nIt's only that much more important to take control of that thing, whatever it is.

attributes.content: This place is completely ruined.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Just like the Rhodes Islanders said, it's another secret network of routes that lead into the city.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Through these hubs, Theresis has shipped huge amounts of steel, crystal units and witchcraft devices into Londinium, enough to repair The Shard and complete that airship.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But how did these materials reach Londinium? Even the dumbest dukes wouldn't let large shipments of materiel outside their control to travel freely around Victoria.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's probably that they, like the Nachzehrer King's legion, appeared out of thin air around the hubs.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The so-called Sarkaz supply line we've been looking for may be the last and least important step of the transport process.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: How did they do it?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Not only that, if Theresis had access methods like this, why isn't he using them directly in battle?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Teleporting armies behind enemy lines, or plopping Originium bombs right on top of ducal flagships.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Either there are limitations to the method... or it's actually really fragile.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Lich called it an Art beyond the realm of Originium Arts, but I just couldn't picture it...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: W, over there—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Uh, no sign of battle. It's completely collapsed.
attributes.name: W

attributes.text: W has looked detached ever since that encounter a few days ago.
\nI saw her gaze absent-mindedly into the fire while on night watch.
\nI can't help her. She'll get through this on her own.

attributes.content: Let's go. There's nothing to see here.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: I look at the map in my hand. Scattered dots mark the locations of the Vampire Arts Circles.
\nI added a few, including the logistics hub just now, and the Nachzehrer King's legion camp.
\nSomething had been placed there using the same methods.
\nThere must be something linking them.
I scan the names on the map. Hills, valleys, small patches of forests, and a few small ponds.
\nSome sort of commonality? Shared geographical traits?
\nMy eyes fall upon the name of a town. Brentwood.

attributes.content: Ines, you said that Rhodes Island analyzed the intel from the Defense Forces command tower, where they had set their sights near a town by the name of Brentwood.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: I draw a circle around Brentwood's location.

attributes.content: Closure came up with the analysis. She stole the records of all cargo movement since Theresis entered the city in 1094, and created an overlapping route map.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: All the towns around Londinium were covered in these cargo movements on the map.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's Victoria's capital, after all. All the steak and wine the citizens enjoyed before the war didn't grow on the shelves.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But the area around Brentwood is strangely empty, with only a few scattered entries around 1094 and 1095.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's pretty weird. Like there's a forgotten town right here in the middle of Victoria.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Rhodes Islanders think Brentwood might be the starting point of the Sarkaz underground railroad, or the hub of a hidden network, implementing some sort of secret embargo.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We just proved the existence of these logistics hubs.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But, we also learned that Theresis has a pair of, well, invisible hands, which lets him puts things anywhere he wants.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We may need to reassess the significance of Brentwood.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The closer we get, the more Vampire Arts Circles we see.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Meanwhile, if we draw a line from the furthest points to Brentwood, we see that they're about equidistant. That might be the logistical limit.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Stop guessing. I know Brentwood. You couldn't hide anything in that poor-ass town. There were barely any Sarkaz vagrants when I visited a few months ago.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Maybe the caravans just don't pass through 'cause there's nothing interesting there.
attributes.name: W

attributes.text: W disinterestedly throws a rock over.
\nShe's in a bad mood alright. She would normally have thrown a grenade pin.
\nThe rock rolls on the map and falls right where I'm looking. I'm about to move it out away—
There's a patch of hills not far behind Brentwood. The rock fell right in the middle of the icons representing hills.

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Let's go. It's not like we have any better leads. Maybe coincidence has something in mind.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Let's start there.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: The hills are dark and eerie.
\nA Victorian history book wrote that the study of history is like walking into a cave, feeling the grains on the wall.
\nWorking blindly in the dark, all you can do is try to piece together the puzzle of where we came from by feeling around in the darkness.
This land is not friendly to history.
\nOriginium veins assimilate any organic tissue around them, even bones.
\nAll that archaeologists had to work with are Originium-infested ruins. All they could do is mull over metal shards.
But we are different. We are Sarkaz.
\nWe have many ways to look back. Legends say that the revenants in the furnace of Kazdel whisper the achievements of a certain King of Sarkaz, or the sad ending of another.
\nWhen I was little, I used to wait by the furnace that never went out, hoping to capture a single echo from the past.
\nBut all I ever heard was silence.

attributes.content: You might actually be right. There's something unusual about the shadows here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: There seems to be a pattern in the chaos.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's like the ripples created by a sailing ship, overlapping and interfering with one another, until nothing is left but entropy.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Not so much sailing as... drifting.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Drifting.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I once heard a story from an old Diαblo, this word came up in his broken whispers.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What story?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: A story of disaster.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Let's hope we don't run into the stuff of those stories.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Let's hope we still have some good luck left in the bank.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: A merc who thinks he's lucky is a dead merc.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Which is why we need you to stay behind, W.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We're not here to fight. We need to figure out what we're facing.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If things go south and we need to pull out...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Don't worry, I won't leave the way open for you.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'll set up the explosives and wait until you're almost at the exit, Vampires and Nachzehrer hot on your tail, maybe Theresis himself, and just as you're about to see the light...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Boom!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You'll become the tragic hero right out of your favorite stories, Hoederer!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You can't handle Theresa on your own, W.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ines.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'll actually bury you, you know.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hmph. You do you.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She really will blow the hills apart though.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We both know she's crazy. No need to provoke her with Theresa's name.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's just pathetic, the act the she's putting on. I'd rather she knew what she wanted.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You've been in the city for so long. If she wanted to know the truth, she could've just asked you.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Did she ever ask if that Theresa was real?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She never asked me, either. She's never grown up.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She could do one of two things: Grovel at that Theresa's feet and beg for forgiveness, or plan to kill her.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But what is this that she's doing? Trying to prove that she's all great and powerful?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Or is she trying to convince herself that nothing ever happened, that all she needs to do is kill people and plant mines like she always has, and it'll all pass?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It would've been fine if she could actually stop thinking about it. But right now, she's like a little girl standing on the ice.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She takes a few steps forward, then a few steps back, looking around the same place, sinking into pointless sentimentality.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I have no idea.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Give me a break. You just don't want the extra trouble.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I didn't know you cared so much about her.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I care about me. I don't want to die because of her.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: In all seriousness, Ines, have you ever thought about going back to Kazdel?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What? Am I in the way of your great plan?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No, it's just occurred to me that W and I have a reason to stay in this war.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But what about you?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I've got my reason too.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Here we are.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We're... inside the hill.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: They hollowed out the whole thing?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Well, that's going to make things easier for W's demolition plan.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Look at the size of these tracks, and the loading mechanism.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That's a big guy.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Shh, get into the shadows.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: When's the next shift?
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Close.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: It's always on time.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: I should've made a report to the boss. I would rather be outside, killing Victorians.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: You're not a warrior.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: I don't need you to tell me! It's just that this place is so... oppressive.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: I see those illusions every day, the things you don't know whether they're real or not.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: It's like a maelstrom that keeps spitting out trash from another dimension.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Good thing Ulšulah is a decent woman who doesn't pick on us for no reason or abuse her authority.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Is she the youngest major ever, according to Military Commission ranks?
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: She's not a member of the Royal Court. She won't go far.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Lady Theresa and the Regent aren't blue-blood devils either.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Screw the Royal Court. Kazdel wasn't won by those old fossils huddling around in a circle.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: But they're the strongest.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: That's because...
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: It's almost time.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Go to the machine and prepare to load.
attributes.name: Quiet Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Did you hear the name they said?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ulšulah.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Could it be...?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's not necessarily the one we're thinking of. Sarkaz names are often codenames or taken from legends.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Ulšulah the Time-Stealer. Ulšulah of the Lock and Key. It's a Sarkaz legend about the Feranmut. Anyone could've drawn from it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Wait... Ulšulah the Time-Stealer?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What's the origin of your name, 'Hoederer'?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Don't have one.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Bells.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Wait, over there...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What's that?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: What was that?
\nThe hills are trembling...
No, space itself is trembling.
For an instant, I see visions beyond reckoning.
Bloated emperors crumbling in halls of gold, ancient bloodborn cutting open their wrists to feed the newborn.
\nDiαbolic flames burning amber. Demons with deer horns prowl beneath great bronze walls, offering battered willow wood.
\nThe one knot falls from nothingness, splitting into countless threads; a red-skinned monster cuts off its own horn, impaling its own chest with it.
Broken shards become whole again. I see a far-away city.
\nCalm, peaceful, not yet wheeled, not yet drowned in hatred. Its beauty is absurd and out of place, even in a dream.
\nFor no reason at all, I am convinced that it was Kazdel. A home that has long ceased to exist, from somewhere in history.
I want to go there, go into there. I want to see what kind of life we once led.
I lift my foot, but put it down in the same place again. I watch it quietly.
\nUntil all is silent.
\nUntil—
A pathetic creature that is naught but bleached bones moves slowly.
\nNerve strands reach out and grab the massive containers.
\nIt still roams this place. It is not dead yet.

attributes.content: This... this is the 'cargo ship'?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: So big... how did Theresis...?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It... it's really...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Ulšulah the Time-Stealer...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What a coincidence, right?
The legend of Ulšulah tells of Kazdel being attacked by a Feranmut that could slow the time of all things and peer into the past through the fog.
Through so many pasts the hero Ulšulah journeyed, rescuing their kin lost in the mirage of time.
Who knew that I, who took the name by happenstance, would one day witness the legend with my own eyes?
You've really ground those horns into shape, Ines. You could almost pass for a true blue Sarkaz.
Ulšulah.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Are you really going to betray General Manfred, Hoederer?
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: I knew you wouldn't kill Ines when I first heard the rumors, but the confidential nature of my work precluded a personal visit to Londinium to see you.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Aren't you supposed to be the handpicked successor to the Scar Market? Sounds like you're already the bone driver here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Is playing a hero of legend worth such loyalty and commitment?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ancient things are not so appealing anymore.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Only one stuck in the past would continue to use the name.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: You could give yourself a new name.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: How would old friends who came a long way to visit be able to find me then?
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Care for a drink?
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: You didn't used to be a drinker.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Used to, huh?
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: You didn't used to swing your sword at me either, Ines.
attributes.name: Ulšulah
